node.title: Abused as a child, Lula wants her trauma recognised in the same way it is for soldiers and first responders
node.description: Victim survivors and women's advocacy groups launch a campaign to have trauma from gender-based violence recognised as an injury so that they have access to better care.

node.title: This community has the highest rate of DV offences in SA, and now its people are saying enough
node.description: The remote South Australian town of Coober Pedy is best known for the opals mined underground, but scratch beneath the surface and there is a far more heartbreaking claim to fame — with abuse affecting more than one in 10 residents.

node.title: How a video of Ahmaud Arbery's death captured the world's attention and led to three murder convictions
node.description: Greg McMichael, his son Travis McMichael and neighbour William "Roddie" Bryan were not charged until a video of the incident emerged, two months after Ahmaud Arbery's murder in 2020.

node.title: BOM summer outlook: It will pay to check for floods before setting out this summer
node.description: Thanks to the La Niña, finally announced on Tuesday, conditions are expected to be wetter than average for parts of the east coast this summer, according to the Bureau of Meteorology's official summer outlook.

node.title: 'What a long time you have waited for this': Massive tract of Cape York land handed back to traditional owners
node.description: The first claims in one of Australia's largest native title applications has been granted on Cape York, the culmination of the "hard work and determination of a lot of people".

node.title: Beating the lights? Scrutiny still possible despite messy legislative rush - expert
node.description: Government excuses over the rushed process for the traffic lights law do not stack up, but there will be a chance to scrutinise health orders made under it, experts say. Audio

node.title: Many migrants heading for UK die after boat sinks
node.description: At least 27 migrants headed for the UK have drowned in the English Channel near Calais after their boat sank.

node.title: Wellington's Evans Bay Parade to be revamped
node.description: A walking and biking route, more parking and pedestrian crossings, and fewer bus stops will all be part of the Evans Bay Parade revamp in the capital.

node.title: Chuck Schumer's father Abe dies at 98
node.description: "He took whatever was thrown at him no matter how difficult, did his job, never complained," the senator said of his father.

node.title: Author Says Outcry Over Book on Preventing Sex Abuse Partly Linked to Their Trans Identity
node.description: Allyn Walker said a book interviewing 40-plus adults who admit sexual attraction to children and have never abused anyone was intended to prevent future abuse.

node.title: NT records one new local COVID-19 case, hard lockdown ending in Rockhole
node.description: A teenager from Binjari has tested positive while in quarantine, while negative test results and wastewater has been returned for the community of Rockhole.

node.title: Govt announces funding boost for self-isolation support and new Covid treatments
node.description: The government has announced a raft of new Covid-19 support including $204.1m to support people self-isolating, $300 million for Pharmac to buy new Covid-19 medicines and making rapid antigen testing…

node.title: South Auckland warehouse blaze saw asbestos travel 1km away - review
node.description: A review of firefighting at a big South Auckland warehouse blaze says asbestos floated up to 1km away as concerns remain over Fire and Emergency safety protocols.

node.title: Covid-19: Hawke's Bay case has little effect on region's testing numbers
node.description: Covid-19 testing numbers in Hawke's Bay have not increased since a positive case was announced in the region.

node.title: Body of missing fisherman found in sea near Raglan
node.description: A body recovered from the sea near Raglan has been identified as one of two fishermen who went missing three weeks ago.

node.title: Michigan school district removes pride flags from classrooms
node.description: The flags will remain out of classrooms until the next of Board of Education vote in December.

node.title: How to Watch the Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade
node.description: This year’s parade will feature performers like Kelly Rowland and Carrie Underwood and will have 15 giant balloons and 28 floats.

node.title: Teacher Fired for Being in Same-Sex Marriage Can Sue Archdiocese, Appeals Court Rules
node.description: A man fired in 2019 from an Indiana Catholic school for being in a same sex marriage is able to continue his lawsuit against the archdiocese that fired him.

node.title: Second Large Commercial-Scale Wind Farm Approved by Biden Administration in as Many Weeks
node.description: The South Fork Wind project is estimated to generate electricity for around 70,000 homes, producing about 130 megawatts.

node.title: Australia effectively locked in to host Rugby World Cup in 2027
node.description: The World Rugby Council will vote again to confirm the decision next year, but Australia is effectively locked in to host the men's tournament in 2027.

node.title: UK politicians outraged by ban on infants in parliament
node.description: British politicians demand a change in rules after a parliamentarian is told she cannot bring her three-month-old son into the House of Commons.

node.title: Former England captain Michael Vaughan axed from BBC's Ashes coverage after racism allegations
node.description: Michael Vaughan strongly denies making racist comments to a number of Asian players in 2009, and says he is "looking forward" to joining Fox Cricket's commentary team for this summer's Ashes series.

node.title: Government nearly loses vote on federal ICAC debate, is saved by COVID technicality
node.description: The Coalition manages to stop a crossbench attempt to bring on debate about a national anti-corruption commission, after government MP Bridget Archer crosses the floor.

node.title: Alleged sex 'cult' leader hit with 18 new charges, court hears
node.description: An alleged sex "cult" leader from northern NSW faces 18 new charges, a court has heard, including sexual intercourse without consent, assault occasioning actual bodily harm.

node.title: Youth Hostel Association to close its hostels after 89 years
node.description: YHA said the the extended Auckland lockdown and no prospects of an international visitors this summer left it an unsustainable financial position.

node.title: More than 30 dead after migrant boat capsizes in English Channel
node.description: It was the worst loss of life on record involving migrants in the narrow stretch of water.

node.title: Shelter lets people foster animals over the holidays
node.description: Some of the foster animals are finding a permanent home.

node.title: A judge will decide if the men convicted of murdering Ahmaud Arbery ever get a chance at parole.
node.description: But under Georgia law, all three men must get sentenced to life in prison.

node.title: NFL, NBA & NHL Thanksgiving Schedule: Full List of Sports to Watch Over the Weekend
node.description: Once you've finished your Thanksgiving traditions, there's dozens of football, hockey and basketball games available to watch on TV this Thanksgiving weekend.

node.title: DOJ Says Alabama Has Yet to Fix Its Prisons Where 33 Inmates Have Died in Last 3 Years
node.description: The United States lawsuit against Alabama claimed the state's prison conditions are so bad they violate the constitution's ban on cruel and unusual punishment.
